sections.text:
This feature defines the minimum viable “CRM-embedded Guidance” surface that lets sellers consume Sales_Accelerator recommendations directly inside Salesforce and HubSpot, eliminating the need to switch tabs or leave their daily workflow. By standardizing a lightweight in-CRM UI (e.g., sidebar panel, record-page card, or extension), we reduce friction to guidance adoption and increase the likelihood that recommendations are seen at the moment decisions are made.

We will specify the entry points and placements for both core objects—Accounts and Opportunities—so guidance appears in predictable, high-visibility locations within each CRM. The spec will clarify when the surface is available (e.g., on record view, potentially in list contexts if applicable), what triggers/conditions show it, and how users discover it consistently across CRM variants.

In scope content blocks will include: (1) Best-next-action guidance, (2) Risk alerts, and (3) Fit/positioning snippets. For each block, we’ll define wireframe-level layout, prioritization, and the “copy actions” sellers can take (e.g., copy a snippet, copy a recommended step, copy notes) to quickly operationalize guidance in emails, call notes, or internal updates.

The primary impact is unblocking implementation tickets by providing a clear UI spec and acceptance criteria: required blocks, minimal interactions, placement by object, and success conditions (what “working” means in Salesforce/HubSpot). This reduces engineering ambiguity and rework, aligns design/product/eng on an MVP that can ship quickly, and creates a foundation to iterate on richer guidance and deeper CRM actions later.
